Method.name: GetInternalInfo
Method.Description:
This method extracts information from the external filename (xxx.yyy.xml) from the String it discovers its type and internal name.
Parameters: externalFileName: the name of the file in the external file system
the results will be assigned to the parameters: internalName: the internal name of the artifact (Example: xxx.MAC, xxxx.yyyy.CLS, etc) type: the type of the file (#MAC, #CLS, #INC, #GBL)
Returns true if there were no errors

Method.name: GetSafeFilename
Method.Description:
Converts a string which might contain accented and path characters into a safe filename to use with any operating system. This safe name uses only ASCII characters and no path characters. In addition, the name will get an appended number that is the checksum on the original string. this garantees that the names "NAME","NAME" (with accents) and "Name" (case) won't collide.
This code only works with 8-bit instalations!

Method.name: UpdateTimeStamp
Method.Description: This method updates the timestamp of the ^SourceControlTimeStamps() The name of the arftifact is the full filename, including the path. this guarantees that different artifacts with the same extension don't colide.

Method.name: IsArtifactOutdated
Method.Description: This method tests if an artifact is outdated when compared to an external timestamp. It looks for the artifact timestamp in ^SourceControlTimeStamps(internalName,extension). If it soens't find the timestamp, or if the timestamp found is older than the external one, the artifact is considred outdated.
